greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of times that the sum of two squares is an integer between n^2 and (n+1)^2; multiple representations are counted multiply.
comment: Related to the circle problem, cf. A077770. Note that 2*a(n)-A077770(n)/4 is the characteristic sequence for the Beatty sequence A001951. See A077769 for a more restrictive case. A077773 counts multiple representations only once.
example: a(8)=7 because 65=64+1, 65=49+16, 68=64+4, 72=36+36, 73=64+9, 74=49+25 and 80=64+16 are between squares 64 and 81. Note that 65 occurs twice.
mathematica: maxN=100; lst={}; For[n=1, n<=maxN, n++, cnt=0; i=n; j=0; While[i>=j, j=1; While[i^2+j^2<(n+1)^2, If[i>=j&&i^2+j^2>n^2, cnt++ ]; j++ ]; i--; j-- ]; AppendTo[lst, cnt]]; lst
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Nov 20 2002
